label.value: immunoprecipitation assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: An immunoprecipitation assay that detects the binding of an antigen with an antibody.

label.value: mass spectrometry assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A mass spectrometry assay that detects the binding of an antigen with an antibody.

label.value: phage display assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A phage display binding assay that detects the binding of an antigen with an antibody.

label.value: electron microscopy assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: An electron microscopy imaging assay that detects the binding of an antigen with an antibody.

label.value: ELISA measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: An enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay that detects the binding of an antigen with an antibody.

label.value: ELISPOT assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: An enzyme-linked immunospot assay that detects the binding of an antigen with an antibody.

label.value: flow cytometry assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A flow cytometry assay that detects the binding of an antigen with an antibody.

label.value: intracellular material detection assay measuring epitope specific granzyme A release by T cells

definition.value: A flow cytometry assay that detects epitope specific granzyme A release by T cells.

label.value: chromatography assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: An analytical chromatography assay that detects the binding of an antigen with an antibody.

label.value: NMR assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses a nuclear magnetic resonance assay.

label.value: ELISA measuring epitope specific granulysin release by T cells

definition.value: An enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay that detects epitope specific granulysin release by T cells.

label.value: intracellular material detection assay measuring epitope specific granulysin release by T cells

definition.value: A flow cytometry assay that detects epitope specific granulysin release by T cells.

label.value: fluorescence detection assay measuring binding off rate [koff] to determine direct binding of a cell-bound-MHC:ligand complex

definition.value: A fluorescence detection assay that measures binding off rate [koff] to detect direct binding of a cell-bound-MHC molecule with a ligand.

label.value: fluorescence detection assay measuring binding on rate [kon] to determine direct binding of a cell-bound-MHC:ligand complex

definition.value: A fluorescence detection assay that measures binding on rate (kon) to detect direct binding of a cell-bound-MHC molecule with a ligand.

label.value: fluorescence detection assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] to determine competitive binding of a purified-MHC:ligand complex approximated by IC50

definition.value: A fluorescence detection assay that measures equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) to detect the loss of binding of a known reference ligand to purified-MHC due to competition by the ligand under investigation and provides IC50 values determined under assay conditions where the IC50 approximates a KD value.

label.value: split-ubiquitin assay

definition.value: A binding assay that screens membrane soluble proteins by fusion of two integral membrane proteins (bait and prey) to two different ubiquitin moieties. One moiety is also fused to a transcription factor (TF) that can be cleaved off by ubiquitin specific proteases. Upon bait and prey interaction, Nub and Cub-moieties assemble, reconstituting the split-ubiquitin. The reconstituted split-ubiquitin molecule is recognized by ubiquitin specific proteases, which cleave off the reporter protein, allowing it to induce the transcription of reporter genes.

label.value: far-western blot assay

definition.value: An assay that measures protein-protein interactions by separating target proteins on an SDS-PAGE gel, transfering them to a solid substrate, hybridizing with a protein probe and visualizing bound proteins using a probe-directed antibody. This is a adaptation on the western blot assay.

label.value: RNA protection assay

definition.value: An assay that determines the presence and estimates abundance of transcript species by first creating an homo or heteroduplex by adding a specific, complementary sequence to the sequence of interest and then exposing the mixture of ribonuclease, which will degrade only single stranded molecules. A detection step will reveal if the sample contained a sequence of interest.

label.value: electrophoretic mobility shift assay

definition.value: An assay that measures information about Protein-DNA or Protein-RNA interactions using gel electrophoresis and relying on the fact the molecular interactions will cause the heterodimer to be retarded on the gel when compared to controls corresponding to protein extract alone and protein extract + neutral nucleic acid.

label.value: gene knock-down assay

definition.value: An assay which transiently disrupts gene transcripts by expressing antisense RNA constructs or delivering RNA interfering molecules in cells.

label.value: nano-cap analysis of gene expression assay

definition.value: A transcription profiling assay that is performed using a very low amount (nanogram scale) of mRNA samples using Cap analysis gene expression (CAGE).

label.value: cap analysis of gene expression assay

definition.value: A transcription profiling assay which measures RNA transcript abundances in biological samples by extracting 5' ends of capped transcripts, RTPCR and sequence those. Copy numbers of CAGE tags provide a way of quantification and provide a measure of expression of the transcriptome

label.value: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-17A production by T cells

definition.value: An enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay that detects interleukin-17A production by T cells.

label.value: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-7 production by T cells

definition.value: A detection of specific nucleic acid polymers with complementary probes that detects interleukin-7 production by T cells.

label.value: yeast 2-hybrid assay

definition.value: An assay that detects protein protein interactions and protein DNA interactions by testing for physical interactions (such as binding) between two proteins or a single protein and a DNA molecule, respectively. The premise behind the test is the activation of downstream reporter gene(s) by the binding of a transcription factor onto an upstream activating sequence (UAS). For two-hybrid screening, the transcription factor is split into two separate fragments, called the binding domain (BD) and activating domain (AD). The BD is the domain responsible for binding to the UAS and the AD is the domain responsible for the activation of transcription. The Y2H is thus a protein-fragment complementation assay.

label.value: Sos-recruitment assay

definition.value: A binding assay that detects interacting proteins for a targeted domain where mammalian guanyl nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) Sos is recruited to the Saccharomyces cerevisiae plasma membrane harboring a temperature-sensitive Ras GEF, Cdc25-2, allowing growth at the nonpermissive temperature using the Sos recruitment system, a kind of yeast 2 hybrid system.

label.value: yeast one-hybrid assay

definition.value: An assay that determines protein DNA interactions using a single fusion protein in which the activating domain is linked directly to the binding domain.

label.value: bacterial one-hybrid assay

definition.value: An assay that identifies the sequence-specific target site of a DNA-binding domain. In this system, a given transcription factor (TF) is expressed as a fusion to a subunit of RNA polymerase. In parallel, a library of randomized oligonucleotides representing potential TF target sequences, is cloned into a separate vector containing the selectable genes HIS3 and URA3. If the DNA-binding domain (bait) binds a potential DNA target site (prey) in vivo, it will recruit RNA polymerase to the promoter and activate transcription of the reporter genes in that clone. The two reporter genes, HIS3 and URA3, allow for positive and negative selections, respectively. At the end of the process, positive clones are sequenced and examined with motif-finding tools in order to resolve the favoured DNA target sequence

label.value: chromosome organization assay by fluorescence in-situ hybridization

definition.value: An in-situ hybridization assay that uses fluorescence to detect chromosomal integrity

label.value: methylation-specific polymerase chain reaction assay

definition.value: An assay that uses initial modification of DNA by sodium bisulfite, converting all unmethylated, but not methylated, cytosines to uracil, and subsequent amplification with primers specific for methylated versus unmethylated DNA.

label.value: amplification of intermethylated sites assay

definition.value: An assay that estimates genome-wide DNA methylation and measures methylation of DNA sequences. AIMS is based on the differential enzymatic digestion of genomic DNA with methylation-sensitive and methylation-insensitive isoschizomers followed by restrained PCR amplification of methylated sequences.

label.value: in-situ hybridization assay

definition.value: An assay that localizes a specific DNA or RNA sequence within a portion or section of tissue using artificially induced nucleic hybridization.

label.value: cytochalasin-induced inhibition of actin polymerization assay

definition.value: An assay which uses compound cytochalasin (CHEBI: 23528) to block actin polymerization-dependent cell motility (GO:0070358) and actin filament polymerization (GO:0030041).

label.value: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from fertility

definition.value: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment based on reduction of fertility.

label.value: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific tolerance induction

definition.value: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a tolerance induction intervention experiment.

label.value: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific induction of hypersensitivity

definition.value: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that detects a hypersensitivity response by monitoring skin reactions.

label.value: assay measuring epitope specific immune complex formation

definition.value: A B cell epitope specific activation of additional immune response assay that detects agglutination in vitro.

label.value: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection based on survival

definition.value: An in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from other challenge using survival.

label.value: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific treatment of disease

definition.value: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that detects a decrease in disease.

label.value: assay measuring B cell epitope specific in vivo activity

definition.value: A B cell epitope dependent biological activity determination assay that uses an in vivo intervention experiment.

label.value: antibody cross-blocking assay

definition.value: A competitive inhibition of binding assay in which two antibodies that are known to bind the same antigen are tested for the ability of one antibody to inhibit binding of the other antibody to the antigen, thereby determining if they have overlapping binding sites.

label.value: immunoprecipitation assay

definition.value: An analyte assay in which an input material is mixed with antibodies and bound antigen:antibody complexes are separated out using immunoprecipitation. Either the antibody has known specificy, and the antigen mixture is tested for the presence of a specific antigen, or the antigen solution is well defined and the antibody solution is tested for the presence of antigen specific antibodies.

label.value: antigen inhibition assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that measures the ability of an antigen to inhibit antibody binding to a known ligand.

label.value: assay measuring qualitative binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: An assay that detects the binding of an antigen with an antibody, and produces a qualitative measurement of the binding as an output.

label.value: assay measuring epitope specific activation of additional immune response in vitro

definition.value: A B cell epitope dependent biological activity determination assay that detects secondary in vitro activity.

label.value: assay measuring epitope specific antigen inhibition of antibody activity

definition.value: A B cell epitope dependent biological activity determination assay that detects inhibition of the antibody's activity by the antigen.

label.value: assay measuring biological activity resulting from B cell epitope:antibody binding

definition.value: A B cell epitope assay that measures the immune response process resulting from the binding of an antibody receptor to epitope or recognition of the epitope.

label.value: assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A B cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the dissociation constant KD.

label.value: assay measuring a binding constant of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

definition.value: A B cell epitope recognition assay that quantitavely characterizes the binding of an antibody / BCR with a ligand by determining a binding constant.

label.value: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from challenge

definition.value: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment.
